intro: Harperocallis longiflora, commonly known as the sweetshrub, is a flowering shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant clusters of white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves that provide a lush backdrop to its showy blossoms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Harperocallis longiflora is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
